body_html:
Ok @peterjc123 after opening Anaconda prompt and updating conda, Anaconda was able to find your pytorch package and installed other packages with it:

cffi:           1.11.2-py36h829d1a5_0
pycparser:      2.18-py36hd053e01_1
pytorch:        0.3.0-py36_0.3.0      peterjc123
sqlite:         3.20.1-h9eeafa9_2
vs2017_runtime: 15.4.27004.2010-0     peterjc123

I guess that's that. All that was needed was
conda update conda

Another thing I was wondering, if I have a geforce GTX 1050 ti graphics card, does it support CUDA 80 or 90?

body:
Ok @peterjc123  after opening Anaconda prompt and updating conda, Anaconda was able to find your pytorch package and installed other packages with it:

    cffi:           1.11.2-py36h829d1a5_0
    pycparser:      2.18-py36hd053e01_1
    pytorch:        0.3.0-py36_0.3.0      peterjc123
    sqlite:         3.20.1-h9eeafa9_2
    vs2017_runtime: 15.4.27004.2010-0     peterjc123

I guess that's that. All that was needed was 
conda update conda

Another thing I was wondering, if I have a geforce GTX 1050 ti graphics card, does it support CUDA 80 or 90?
